Reviews.Title: The Last of the Real Palm Breed
Reviews.Author: Clint W
Reviews.Content: This Centro purchase was actually my second.  It replaced my first one after the on/off button finally disintegrated.  I have been using a version of the Palm since the 90's.  For me, it is the perfect Personal Information Manager (PIM) with calendar, address book, memo book and task manager.  The OS is totally rock solid.  The combination of a Palm device that includes a cell phone is all I need and want.  I do not have a carrier data plan and pay only for cell minutes, then plus any text and data minutes I choose to use.  Sadly, this is the last of the old (pre-Web OS) instruments.  Even the current Apple Mac OS won't sink with it now.  Technology has moved on to what is considered better at the expense of reliability and ease of use.  If you're still using the older (better) Palm OS and want the convenience of all that information in the same package with a phone, then this is your instrument.

Reviews.Title: Buy 2!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey D. Emmert "I'm here because you broke...
Reviews.Content: If you have a Treo 650 or 700p and enjoy using Palm's contacts and calendars like I do, you'll love this Centro 690. The Palm Desktop software (not included but found on the HP website using a Google search) easily collected all of the contacts, call logs, calendar events and software from my old Treo 650 and transferred them to my new Centro. It's like having a new and improved Treo in a slightly smaller box. Activation with Verizon was also easy. Pressing *228 for activation, I entered the phone number of the old Treo, an account password, and within a few minutes, had my old friend in a shiny, new package. Like the Treo, this is one of the last smartphones that doesn't require Verizon's expensive data plan. I should have bought two!

Reviews.Title: Long live the Palm Centro
Reviews.Author: Gink the WonderBunny
Reviews.Content: Yes, awesome phone.  I purchased two (through Verizon, not Amazon) when they had a two-for-one special several years ago.  It was my daughter's first phone--she refers to it as a dinosaur, so I got her an iPhone and am keeping her Centro around as a backup in case mine ever fails.  Love, the Palm OS, the battery life, the PIM app I use on it (Info Select, sadly no longer supported), and will find it nearly impossible to replace if/when it ever dies.  Long live the Palm Centro!  Recently went to Japan and 3G works fine there.

Reviews.Title: Great Power PIM PDA phone with no data contract required
Reviews.Author: nonamespecified
Reviews.Content: how many phones are out there that give you powerful PDA PIM features and Bluetooth handsfree for car, but dont require a data plan?  The Palm Centro fills the bill.  I was able to get it on Sprint with no data plan, but took some arguing with the phone rep, but they finally relented.  For phone/texting/pda and PC sync, this cant be beat.  Though it is getting harder to sync to a PC with Windows 7, I sync to Vista ok, but Windows 7 will not sync to this with either USB or Bluetooth.

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: laykala
Reviews.Content: Overall a very good phone. Battery life is amazing. I use it mainly as phone only and also listening music. I will recommend this phone to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great phone, does everything you need to keep organized.
Reviews.Author: A. Cheng "acheng"
Reviews.Content: Great phone, does everything you need to keep organized.  This is the smart phone that actually help you save time instead of wasting time on playing games.

Reviews.Title: great phone with all the Palm apps
Reviews.Author: GH
Reviews.Content: Does every thing I need, and in a nice package. I have used Palms from the Pilot on and love their apps! This is the last phone with Palm OS and the standard Palm apps, and the cell phone has good sound quality with all the features a person wants. The only area needing improvment is the camera.

Reviews.Title: LOST ALARM'S SOLUTION.  REMOVE THE  BATTERY, WAIT 2 MINUTES, AND REPLACE IT. ALL ALARMS WORK FINE.
Reviews.Author: Joe Mayone Sr.
Reviews.Content: 2nd bought in last 3 months and both lost their ALARM/ALERT systems, their almost worthless now.Don't waste your money.10/29/13LOST ALARM'S SOLUTION.  REMOVE THE  BATTERY, WAIT 2 MINUTES, AND REPLACE IT. ALL ALARMS WORK FINE.

Reviews.Title: Meets expectations
Reviews.Author: T. Footman
Reviews.Content: If you are a Verizon Wireless customer and a cell phone with a PDA function is all you need then this phone is for.

Reviews.Title: Best Smart Phone with Verizon - NO DATA REQUIRED!!!
Reviews.Author: mom and pop
Reviews.Content: Great phone that Verizon will allow you to block the data package! I love the planner, OS and voice dial. Texting is in chat format and I LOVE that feature!!! It came in great shape and I am very happy!

Reviews.Title: didn't work well
Reviews.Author: Beth J. Cobbs
Reviews.Content: i had a palm centro be4 but the phone after my baby played with it for a few sec stopped working even with a case on! otherwise i like the features of the phone but its a little hard to hear

Reviews.Title: Less than a month it locked up
Reviews.Author: T. Peterson
Reviews.Content: Took it into the Verizon store because a weird app showed up saying to connect to laptop an  would not go away. It obviously had a virus in the phone before I received it since I had not used the phone to access on line at all. Now the phone is worthless to use.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Myron F Wilson
Reviews.Content: I had a Palm before so I didn't need to learn how to use it.  It works just fine.  I suppose I've used a Palm for 10 years?  A long time. in the life of electronics.

Reviews.Title: contract was needed
Reviews.Author: cindy rangel
Reviews.Content: When I called to activate the phone on a prepaid account they said it had to have a contract. Kept it anyways.

Reviews.Title: Okay phone
Reviews.Author: Heidi Baker
Reviews.Content: The battery died very quickly even though this phone was "new". It is hard to navigate on this phone and to be able to find the settings that you want.

Reviews.Title: best thing around!!!
Reviews.Author: Usher Gluck
Reviews.Content: couldn't get any better! fits all my needs. very organized layout with everything in front of you. would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: Haven't used it yet but it looks good, no blemishes.
Reviews.Author: Grammy "Susieq"
Reviews.Content: Phone does turn on to access contacts, etc. I always order a backup phone as my phone seems to get older and this one will be put to use when my current phone goes out. I like the qwerty keyboard.

Reviews.Title: phone did not work right
Reviews.Author: sandra
Reviews.Content: had to send phone back didn't work right I do not want another like this could not type key board to small

Reviews.Title: Yes, I'm hanging on to a dinosaur!
Reviews.Author: My-T-Mouse
Reviews.Content: The Palm Centro is a great little phone.  I bought one as a replacement for my 4+-year-old Centro that I accidentally ruined.  The phone itself is great.  The battery I received, however, would not hold a charge.  I am using the battery from my old phone and hoping it holds up as it is almost impossible to find a replacement battery.Also, Verizon told me that they will only activate this phone without a data plan if it is directly replacing another Palm Centro that did not have a data plan.  I fit this criteria, thankfully.

Reviews.Title: mr. joel
Reviews.Author: joel
Reviews.Content: exellant gret i'm very happy with this prodoct i'm recomending it for every one to buy itlots of luck

Reviews.Title: Great little phone
Reviews.Author: Book Lady
Reviews.Content: These are like mini-Palm Treos - awesome little phones. The buttons are a bit small on the keyboard, but with teenager's nimble fingers, it shouldn't be a problem.I went round and round with 2 Verizon reps trying to get the two I purchased activated without a data plan - both reps were very insistent that the phones had to have it. The trick is for them to disable all data on the number/account *first*, then add the phone, and then it won't require the data plan to activate. You may be able to disable the data on your existing number on the site then go through the online activation process, but I did it by phone. Doing it this way on the 2nd call also allowed my Treo 700p to be activated, when the previous rep couldn't get it activated without it requiring the data.Can't speak much to the camera or other functions, as we have not used them yet, but I did want to note the way we were able to get them activated in case it helps someone.

Reviews.Title: First Palm Phone
Reviews.Author: Dragonfly
Reviews.Content: I ordered 2 of these phones to replace two broken phones. It is much more budget friendly to purchase a no contract phone, than to purchase through Verizon. They add on all kinds of "one time" activation fees for contract phones. It was awesome to tell the Verizon agent that we didn't have to purchase 2 $40 data plans! The agent has a Palm of her own and didn't know it was possible. She was delighted and going to change her plans. LOL! It is truly one of the last phones you can do this with.As for the phone itself, we are happy with them. Battery life holds up great!!!! Only issues are keys are on the small side, and you can't rearrange the placement of the apps on the screen, or maybe you can and we haven't figured it out yet.Considering purchasing another one for back-up.

Reviews.Title: Centro is for Power PIM Users
Reviews.Author: Davi d Cmelik
Reviews.Content: The Palm Centro is "old" technology. Its web browser (Blazer) is far extinct, but usable on *most* textual sites, including CNN, and others. It won't play videos anymore as it once did because the technology has far outpaced it. I write this in 2012. The Palm 690 Centro's debut was five years ago and even then its aging Palm OS/Treo system was getting a little long in the tooth for casual phone users. BUT for power PIM users who want a tether to their PC desktop, I don't see a reasonable alternative. Droid and iPad/iPhone do not cater to business users and most manufacturers have discarded the notion that buyers want a tether to a PC (or deliberately prevent it to sell other technology). I give this phone 5 stars-- even though I am theoretically trading down from a Droid Pro and before that a Galaxy S II. I also gave away my iPad to my wife as I am not a web browser. I need PIM.

Reviews.Title: nut good servise
Reviews.Author: a green
Reviews.Content: Earpiece volume is not the same when i but it when i talk  to sum 1 its very hard 2 her me clear

Reviews.Title: Didn't work out for me
Reviews.Author: BEAR_CUB
Reviews.Content: Phone was constantly trying to hot sync to other computers (like a dog in heat). I never requested this hot sync function, but it bogged down the phone and rendered it useless.

Reviews.Title: Not what I thought it would be.
Reviews.Author: David Wilson
Reviews.Content: The quality of the phone looks way out dated. I gave it to my son for a early Easter present and I can tell he was disappointed.
